main event: An unidentified aerial object described as a ball or three pointed stars, silver or bluish white, was sighted in Southfalls, Montana on May 22, 1951.
interesting points: The object was observed for a duration of 30 minutes,It appeared and disappeared against the blue sky,The object was noted to have no reported velocity,There were suggestions that it could be a balloon released from Great Falls AFB,The sighting was part of a broader investigation involving multiple reports during that time.
sighted object: a ball or three pointed stars
